intro: Neogymnantha neocummingii, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. It produces woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Neogymnantha neocummingii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is considered a rare species in its native habitat.
